comments.author: hkelsey@algorithmics.com
comments.creator: hkelsey@algorithmics.com
comments.text: On a United Kingdom keyboard event.keyCode in onkeydown returns 51 for both the 3/£ key and the #/~ key. On windows this working correctly, 51 is returned for the 3/£ key and 222 for the #/~ key.
comments.raw_text: On a United Kingdom keyboard event.keyCode in onkeydown returns 51 for both the 3/£ key and the #/~ key. On windows this working correctly, 51 is returned for the 3/£ key and 222 for the #/~ key.

comments.author: virgil.dicu@softvision.ro
comments.creator: virgil.dicu@softvision.ro
comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110815 Firefox/8.0a1

Have you tried this issue on other browsers as well?

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode?
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile?
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#Make_a_new_profile

How did you test this issue? What site did you use in order to check the codes?

comments.author: hkelsey@algorithmics.com
comments.raw_text: It occurs on chrome as well, it was tested on our webapp but is simple to reproduce just use event.keyCode.
comments.text: It occurs on chrome as well, it was tested on our webapp but is simple to reproduce just use event.keyCode.

comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text:
Can you use event.key instead?
It seems .keyCode has its problems and is deprecated.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/keyCode

Can you use event.key instead?
It seems .keyCode has its problems and is deprecated.
